programme.title: Assassination attempt on Ford
programme.short_synopsis: Are presidents too at risk to mingle with crowds, and is it necessary in the TV age?
programme.medium_synopsis: President Ford is saved from assassination attempt in Sacramento, and the perils of taped broadcasting, when it comes to commenting on up-to-the-minute news.

programme.title: Letter from America by Alistair Cooke
programme.short_synopsis: Alistair Cooke’s weekly talks on American life, history and politics from 1946 – 2004.
